sentence.text: Here we show, using whole-exome and cancer gene panel sequencing of 79 aGCTs from two independent cohorts, that truncating mutation of the histone lysine methyltransferase gene response to estrogen (also known as MLL2) is a recurrent somatic event in aGCT.
IHC detects additional non-response to estrogen-mutated aGCTs with loss of nuclear KMT2D expression, suggesting that non-genetic KMT2D inactivation may occur in this tumor type.

Adult-type granulosa cell tumors of the ovary (aGCTs) are rare gynecologic malignancies that exhibit a high frequency of somatic negative regulation of transcription, DNA-templated c.C402G (p.Cys134Trp) mutation.
